text: this is Jimmy Wang for the New York
Times
China's provinces are in a race to see
who can grow fastest
as factories all over the country such
as this steel manufacturing plant in
Hebei fuel China's growth there is
growing demand for water
but not all places in China are equally
blessed with water the dry North has
always lacked it while the lush South
has always had too much seeking to
ensure northern China's economic growth
Beijing came up with the solution
transfer water from the south to the
north these workers are constructing the
mega project the central and eastern
lines of the project will transport six
trillion gallons of water per year from
the South more than 700 miles to the dry
nor water for the sixty two billion
dollar project is critical for the north
which is experiencing a drought so
severe the UN food agency recently
issued an alert but there is a problem
with this massive project industrial
runoff and municipal waste from rivers
feeding the pipes carrying water north
have rendered some of that water
unusable Wang Jian is a water expert who
lives in Beijing he says the biggest
pollution problem is along the eastern
line of the project due to China's
geography the rivers flow from west to
the east it's unavoidable that there's
pollution downstream a lot of municipal
waste industry pollution and
agricultural waste end up affecting the
water in the eastern line so much money
has been spent to send water north from
the South but the water quality is poor
cities have to build sewage treatment
plants to purify the water and it adds
to the already incredibly high cost much
of the polluted water flowing into the
eastern line is now classified as unfit
for human contact prompting the
government to build hundreds of sewage
treatment plants in the southern cities
of jang-soo and yong-jo to clean the
water before it is pumped north
industrial runoff and municipal wastes
are so serious in some places here that
cranes on floating barges are used to
remove large tracts of waste geo bottom
the only one pollution and emissions get
lowered water isn't polluted
well this water be helpful and effective
from northern China will be bondage hi
general you if water brought north it's
polluted it'll cost us more to clean it
and it'll also be impossible to make use
of the resources so this is a very
important issue
jingo been here how quaint you know but
even after billions of dollars have been
spent on the transfer project water
expected to arrive in the north from the
eastern line of the transfer project is
undrinkable the additional costs of
cleaning water and the disappointing
results thus far have forced cities in
the north to consider alternatives Jang
Jin is considering launching sea water
desalination projects instead of using
water from the transfer project to solve
this problem you see the water prices
are rising rapidly right now and as
water scarcity becomes more severe in
northern China the future price of water
will tend to rise as well instead of
transferring water to meet the growing
demands of a city we should decide the
size of a city according to how much
water resources it has naturally if we
don't follow this principle the transfer
project will help only in the short term
the scale of cities development is
getting bigger and bigger there's no
limit to people's desire for development
your mailed to you
